name: Exeltel
language: Exelcom, Exelquad, Exelspeech.Exelbasic+ delivered on cartridge
keyboard: detachable full-stroke keyboard, numeric keypad, 79 keys
ports: Cartridge slot, exelm?moire slot, expansion slot, tape-recorder, keyboard
description:
In 1986, as the micro-computer market was getting ill, some french manufacturers thought that Telematic was the solution. Oric with the Telestrat, Thomson with the TO-9+ and Exelvision with the Exeltel proposed computers with built-in modems and teletext features.

The Exeltel was surely the most innovative of these three systems. It's a "super Minitel" wich  can also be used as an answering machine, or can be your children teacher by downloading educative software through a dedicated network.

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> MAIN BOX</strong></font><br><blockquote>On the right side : on/off switch and reset button. Next to them, a cartrige slot.</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> REAR</strong></font><br><blockquote>On the right side you can guess the keyboard connector. Then at the back : the power socket, the expansion ports and the video cable...</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMPLETE SETUP</strong></font><br><blockquote>This pictures shows and Exeltel with an Exeldisk, a tape-recorder, a mouse and a printer. The computer is actually connectef to a Teletext service.</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> AMPER EXELTEL</strong></font><br><blockquote>This model was marketed by Amper in spain. Notice "ñ" key on the keyboard.<p class="petitgris">Thanks to homecomputer-80 (Ebay seller) for this picture</p></blockquote>

(1984)</strong></font><br><blockquote>This is nearly a stupid scan ! <br><br> The young boy says : ''In 1984, my father bought me a MO-5" <br> And on his desk is a 1998 calendar... <br><br> They meant that if you bought the MO-5 then (the advert is from 1984), you would be rich and clever 14 years later (in 1998). Ha ha ha !! <br><br> It's funny to see how they tried to represent an office and a town of 1998. I really love this one !  </blockquote>

item.description: Controllers||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> CONTROLLERS</strong></font><br><blockquote>These joysticks use infra-red signals to communicate with the unit.</blockquote>

Controllers|||Inside|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> CONTROLLERS</strong></font><br><strong>> Inside</strong><br><blockquote>Notice the battery cell used to send infra-red signals to the main unit !</blockquote>

EXL-188|||Exeldisk prototype ?|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> EXL-188</strong></font><br><strong>> Exeldisk prototype ?</strong><br><blockquote>This extension (under the printer and the EXL-100 unit) was presented as the Exeldisk, but was never sold and finally replaced by the EXL-135. What are the differences ?</blockquote>

Connection||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> CONNECTION</strong></font><br><blockquote>This shows an exledisk connected to an Exeltel through an Exelmémoire cartridge... There is also an expansion cartridge inserted (for RS232, Serial, etc...).</blockquote>

overview||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> OVERVIEW</strong></font><br><blockquote>Exeldrums is quite an original expansion. It plugs at the rear of the system and acts as a digital drum machine with a built-in sequencer ! It has been developped with Hohner. <br><br> The EXL-100 can thus play 6 different instruments at the same time chosen from 17. There are already 16 rythm presets built-in the system, and 54 more can be created. The output is stereo and can be connected to a hi-fi through the "audio output" socket. Quite impressive.</blockquote>

modem for the Exelvision computers||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> MODEM FOR THE EXELVISION COMPUTERS</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to laretrotienda (Ebay seller) for this picture</p></blockquote>

Exelmouse||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> EXELMOUSE</strong></font><br><blockquote>This nice mouse can only be used with the right expansion box.<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://members.nbci.com/soyouzfr/musee.htm" target="_blank">Xavier Bonnefoy</a> for this picture</p></blockquote>

connectors||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> CONNECTORS</strong></font><br><blockquote>This extension, built in the same plastic box as the Exelmodem offers a serial port, a centronics port and a mouse connector. It really looks like an Exelmodem...without the modem. This expansion box was surely conceived for the Exeltel which already had a built-in modem...<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://members.nbci.com/soyouzfr/musee.htm" target="_blank">Xavier Bonnefoy</a> for this picture</p></blockquote>

Exelm?moire||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> EXELMÉMOIRE</strong></font><br><blockquote>This small card can store up to 16k. It plugs at the back of the computer. 64k Exelmémoires were planned but it's not clear if they were ever sold. Note the round battery cell on the board.</blockquote>

64k Exelm?moire||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> 64K EXELMÉMOIRE</strong></font><br><blockquote>Normal Exelmémoire had 16k, but long-awaited 64k cartridges were sold at "the end" of Exelvision...<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://members.nbci.com/soyouzfr/musee.htm" target="_blank">Xavier Bonnefoy</a> for this picture</p></blockquote>
EXL-80|||Printer|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> EXL-80</strong></font><br><strong>> Printer</strong><br><blockquote>This was the official Exlevision printer, built by the CGCT.</blockquote>

EXL-80 prototype||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> EXL-80 PROTOTYPE</strong></font><br><blockquote>The EXL-80 was conceived by Euroterminal and produced by the CGCT. It can be used with the Exelvision computers as well as other computers. It's a impact-matrix printer with a 9-pins printing head. The character matrix is of 7 by 9 points. It can print 100 characters / sec. and has an optimised bi-directional printing. It has 96 different characters (ASCII). The graphical resolution is 72 x 72 dpi. <br><br> Printing density : 10, 12, 15 or 16.6 characters/inch<br> Line spacing : 6 and 8 lines/inch<br> Printing attributes : double height, double width, underline<br> Printing field : 203.2 mm<br> Interfaces : Parallel/Centronic, Serial V24 (otional), Videotex (optional), RS-422/RS-485 (optional), IEEE-488 (optional)</blockquote>

Exelwriter||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> EXELWRITER</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://members.nbci.com/soyouzfr/musee.htm" target="_blank">Xavier Bonnefoy</a> for this picture</p></blockquote>

Tape-recorder||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> TAPE-RECORDER</strong></font><br><blockquote>This classic rebadged tape-recorder was also used by other computers, such as the Philips VG-5000...</blockquote>
